intro: Chazaliella poggei, commonly known as the Bog Chazalia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in marshy or swampy habitats.
